description: Minor material amendment (S.73) to vary condition no.2 (approved plans), seeking to allow changes on the third floor and roof to accommodate an additional bedroom, in pursuant to planning permission reference 202510FUL dated 13/11/2021 for ''Conversion of upper floors into 5 self-contained residential units (2x studio and 3x1-bed) and associated shopfront and courtyard alterations; three storey rear extension; raising of the main roof ridge height; alteration of roof from hip to gable end and rear mansard roof extension with installation of 3 no. rooflights to front roofslope; change of use of ground floor and basement level from approved shop (Use Class A1) to clinic/offices (Mixed Use Class B1/D1).''Class B1/D1).
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of the original permission (202510FUL) being 13/11/2020. The development shall therefore have begun prior to 13/11/2023.

Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title numbers: 18/22/120C - Proposed Ground & Basement Plan, 18/22/121C - Proposed First & Second Plan, 18/22/122E - Proposed Third & Roof Plan, 18/22/123C - Proposed North & South Elevations, 18/22/124C - Proposed Section AA, 18/22/125C - Proposed Section BB, 18/22/126C - Block Plan, 18/22/127 - Site Location Plan, 18/22/128 - Approved Floorplans, 18/22/129 - Existing & Approved Elevations, 18/22/130 - Existing & Approved Sections, 18/22/131B - Proposed 3D View 1, 18/22/132A - Proposed 3D View 2, 18/22/133B - Proposed 3D View 3, 18/22/134 - Proposed 3D View 4, 18/22/135A - Proposed 3D View 5, 18/22/136 - Proposed 3D View 6, 18/22/137A - Proposed 3D View 7, 18/22/138 - Proposed 3D View 8, 18/22/139A - Proposed 3D View 9, 18/22/139 - Existing Floorplans, Heritage Statement prepared by WHH Van Sickle (dated June 2020), Design & Access Statement prepared by Danks Bandell Architects Ltd (dated June 2020), Daylight & Sunlight Assessment prepared by ACCON UK (dated June 2020)

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | The materials to be used for the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing, unless where stated on either the submitted application form or the drawings / plans as listed in Condition (2).

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with Policies D1 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and Policies 7.4, 7.6 and 7B of Adopted Ealing Development Management Plan Document (2013), polices 1.1 (k) and 1.2 (f) of the adopted Development (Core) Strategy (2012).
| Prior to first occupation, the refuse and recycling storage areas shall be implemented in accordance with the submitted documentation and Council Policy and retained thereafter.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area and in the interests of the future occupants of the development in accordance with policies with policies 3.5 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan 2013, policies 1.1 (e) of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy and Policy D4 and D6 of the London Plan (2021). | Cycle parking for 5 no. bicycles shall be implemented in a secure and lockable compound, prior to first occupation and shall be retained thereafter.

Reason: In the interests of the adequate cycle storage and disposal, storage and collection of waste and recycling, to protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area and in the interests of highway and pedestrian safety all in accordance with policies 1.1 (e) and 6.1 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy T5 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021). | The sound insulation of the building envelope (including glazing specifications) shall be installed in accordance with the Council's criteria stated in SPG10 and ensure that the noise standards specified in BS8233:2014 will be met for internal rooms and external amenity areas. Acoustically attenuated mechanical ventilation and cooling shall be installed if necessary (with air intake from the cleanest aspect of the building). Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site is not adversely affected by noise, in accordance with Policies To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise, vibration, dust, lighting or other emissions from the site, in accordance with Policies 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), and policies D14 of the London Plan (2021), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021). | The development shall be implemented in accordance with the fire strategy drawings No's 18/22/148A - Fire Escape Route (Basement & Ground Floor), 18/22/149A - Fire Escape Route (First & Second Floor), 18/22/150A - Fire Escape Route (Third to Sixth Floors), 18/22/151A - Fire Escape Route (Seventh Floor) and 18/22/152 - Fire Strategy Hydrant and Fire Appliance.

Reason: In the interests of fire safety and to ensure the safety of all building users, and the safe and dignified emergency evacuation of all building users in accordance with Policy D12 of the London Plan (2021).
